cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northward, then turning north-northeast parallel to the west coast of Florida toward the north-Florida Big Bend before moving inland across the southeastern United States.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend region near Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Egmont Key to the Steinhatchee River, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flamingo northward to Ochlockonee River, FL (includes Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from Flamingo through Tampa Bay and the Big Bend region
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with gusts possibly near hurricane strength expected Tuesday evening through early Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of inundation possible in Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with locally higher amounts to 8 inches could cause flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents.
